title: (x) Leo Burnett has moved - Hellenic Wide, Egiziano {Eduardo, Mark S}
content: \<font class="dontLookLikeCrap"\>hmmm This is a Sagmeister postcard ![from a postcard](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142543im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/25394.jpg)\</font\>
author: apocalypso

comments.content:
Hey guys   
   
I don't know why the title of this post is wrong, I don't know how to change it

Looks like Hellenic Wide?   
See related discussions [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142543/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/16601.html).

The bold font could be [Egiziano](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142543/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=205098) or Font Bureau's [Giza](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142543/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/font_frames.tpl?fontname=Giza). The other one looks like Hellenic Wide to me, too. I used it on the TypeCon logo last year. I don't know of any digital versions of it. (I scanned and traced the characters I needed from an old type specimen book.)

_I don't know why the title of this post is wrong, I don't know how to change it._   
   
You can't, but Yves or one of the other moderators can.

_I don't know of any digital versions of it._   
   
In the discussion Eduardo linked above, I mentioned that a version of Hellenic Wide re-named "Hefty" by FontBank is still available, and gave a link to a site where you can get it for $2.

Thanks guys!   
   
p.s. I'm not on drugs : )
